dmca.title: DMCA Complaint from the NY Times
dmca.body:
Dear Sir or Madam: 

I am with the Legal Department of The New York Times Company, which publishes The New York Times newspaper, the websites www.nytimes.com and is the owner of the trademark "The New York Times" (registration number 227,904). 

We recently learned of the existence of http://rozius.blogspot.com/, a website owned by Google. This website is publishing on a regular basis numerous articles from www.nytimes.com (see attached list of New York Times articles taken from links on http://rozius.blogspot.com/). All these New York Times articles can be found on www.nytimes.com. 

This letter serves as The New York Times's notification to you under the Digital Millenium Copyright Act that the http://rozius.blogspot.com/ site is infringing our copyrights as described above. 

I have a good faith belief that use of copyrighted materials described above as allegedly infringing is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. 

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. 

On behalf of The New York Times, I hereby request that Google immediately disable and take down the infringing materials. THIS IS A DMCA TAKE DOWN NOTICE. 

Thank you in advance for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, 
[signed]
[private]


[two-page list of urls]
